column2: ENGLISH
Send [Root.GetTitledFirstName] to train with a Mercenary Company
Send your son to train with a Mercenary company for some years and hope he returns as a hardened soldier.
Send [Root.GetTitledFirstName] to train with a Mercenary company
You have decided to send your son to a Mercenary company to train.
On second thought no, he shall remain with me.
Send [Root.GetTitledFirstName] to study at the Neoplatonic Akademia
Send your son to study at the Neoplatonic Akademia
Send your son to study at the Neoplatonic Akademia for some years and hope they return as an enlightened scholar.
You have decided to send your son to the Neoplatonic Akademia to study.
Send your son to study with the Druids
Send [Root.GetTitledFirstName] to study with the Druids
Send your son to study with the Druids for some years and hope they return wiser.
You have decided to send your son with the Druids to study.
Hold a festival to honor [Root.Religion.GetHighGodNameCap]

It is a tradition of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith to hold a festival to honor [Root.Religion.GetHighGodNameCap] and place offerings and sacrifices in a great altar built to honor [Root.Religion.GetHighGodNameCap] for the occasion.
column3: Le festival de l'Uzgavenes se tient au printemps pour célébrer la fin de l'hiver et la venue de l'été.
column4: Das Uzgavenes Fest findet im FrÃ¼hling statt, um das Ende des Winters und das Kommen des Sommers zu feiern.
column6: El festival Uzgavenes se celebra en primavera para celebrar el fin del invierno y la llegada del verano.

column2: You begin preparations for the festival to honor [Root.Religion.GetHighGodNameCap].
column3: Vous commencez les préparatifs pour le festival de l'Uzgavenes.
column4: Ihr beginnt die Vorbereitungen für das Uzgavenes Fest.
column6: Empiezas las preparaciones para el festival Uzgavenes.

column2: Invitations have gone out to your vassals asking them to join you in this festival to honor [Root.Religion.GetHighGodNameCap]. You have decided to make the festival this year a special one, remembered by both spirits and men for many years to come.
column3: Les invitations à venir vous joindre pour célébrer le festival de l'Uzgavenes ont été envoyées à vos vassaux. Vous avez décidé de célébrer ce festival en grand, afin que que les esprits et les hommes s'en souviennent pour plusieurs années.
column4: Zum Uzgavenes Fest wurden an Eure Vasallen Einladungen verschickt. Ihr habt beschlossen, das diesjährige Fest zu etwas Besonderem zu machen, an das sich Götter und Menschen noch viele Jahre erinnern werden.
column6: Las invitaciones para tus vasallos han salido, pidiéndoles que se unan a la fiesta Uzgavenes de esta primavera. Has decidido que el festival de este año sea especial, recordado por espíritus y hombres durante muchos años.

column2: Invitation to the festival to honor [Root.Religion.GetHighGodNameCap] is sent.
column3: L'invitation pour le festival de l'Uzgavenes  est envoyée.
column4: Einladung zum Uzgavenes Fest wurde verschickt.
column6: La invitaciÃ³n para la fiesta de Uzgavenes ha sido enviada.

column2: [From.GetTitledFirstName], your liege, has invited you to join [From.GetHerHim] for this festival to honor [Root.Religion.GetHighGodNameCap]. There you will celebrate the coming of summer and the victory of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodNameCap] over [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName]!
column3: [From.GetTitledFirstName], votre seigneur, vous a invité(e) à son festival de l'Uzgavenes. Vous y célébrerez la venue de l'été et la victoire de Kanapinis, l'esprit du printemps, sur Lašininis, l'esprit de l'hiver.
column4: [From.GetTitledFirstName], Euer Lehnsherr, hat Euch zum diesjährigen Uzgavenes Fest eingeladen. Ihr werdet das Kommen des Sommers und die Niederlage von Lašininis, dem Wintergeist, durch die Hand Kanapinis, dem Geist des Frühlings, feiern.
column6: [From.GetTitledFirstName], tu señor, te ha invitado a unirte a [From.GetHerHim] para la fiesta de primavera de Uzgavenes. Allí celebrarás la llegada del verano y la derrota de Lašininis , el espíritu del invierno, en manos de Kanapinis , el espíritu de la primavera.

column2: [From.GetTitledFirstName] has declined your invitation to attend the festival to honor [Root.Religion.GetHighGodNameCap]! Apparently [From.GetSheHe] has no faith in [Root.Religion.GetHighGodNameCap], and instead follows the strange rituals of some other religion that is foreign to our ways.
column3: [From.GetTitledFirstName] a décliné votre invitation à votre festival de l'Uzgavenes ! [From.GetSheHe] ne croit apparemment pas en Lašininis, Kanapinis ou les autres esprits, et préfère suivre de bizarres rituels religieux qui vous sont étrangers.
column4: [From.GetTitledFirstName] hat Eure Einladung zum Uzgavenes Fest ausgeschlagen! Offenbar hat [From.GetSheHe] kein Vertrauen in Lašininis, Kanapinis und die anderen Geister und folgt stattdessen den seltsamen Ritualen fremder Religionen.
column6: ¡[From.GetTitledFirstName] ha declinado tu invitación para asistir al festival Uzgavenes! Al parecer [From.GetSheHe] no tiene fe en Lašininis, Kanapinis y los otros espíritus, y en su lugar sigue los extraños rituales de otra religión ajena a la nuestra.

column2: Your vassals have arrived and the time of the festival to honor [Root.Religion.GetHighGodNameCap] is upon us. Offerings and sacrifices are put on a great altar, and a symbolic fight is staged between the foul [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName] and [Root.Religion.GetHighGodNameCap]. To everyone's delight, [Root.Religion.GetHighGodNameCap] emerges victorious - as always.
column3: Vos vassaux sont arrivés et le jour est venu de célébrer le festival de l'Uzgavenes. Une énorme effigie représentant l'hiver est brûlée et une bataille symbolique entre Lašininis, l'esprit de l'hiver, et Kanapinis, l'esprit personnifiant le printemps, est mise en scène. Pour le plus grand bonheur de tous, Kanapinis en sort victorieux, comme toujours.
column4: Eure Vasallen sind angekommen und die Zeit des Uzgavenes Festes ist nahe. Ein großes Bildnis, das den Winter darstellt, wird verbrannt und ein symbolischer Kampf zwischen Lašininis, dem Wintergeist, und Kanapinis, dem Geist des Frühlings, findet statt. Zur Freude aller siegt - wie immer - Kanapinis.
column6: Tus vasallos han llegado y es el momento del festival Uzgavenes. Se quema una gran efigie que representa el invierno, y se celebra una lucha simbólica entre Lašininis, el espíritu del invierno, y Kanapinis, el espíritu que personifica la primavera. Para el deleite de todos, Kanapinis sale victorioso, como siempre.

column2: Take that, [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName]!

At last, the time of the festival to honor [Root.Religion.GetHighGodNameCap] is upon us. Offerings and sacrifices are put in a great altar, and a symbolic fight is staged between the foul [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName] and [Root.Religion.GetHighGodNameCap]. To everyone's delight, [Root.Religion.GetHighGodNameCap] emerges victorious - as always.
column3: Vos vassaux sont arrivÃ©s et le jour est venu de célébrer le festival de l'Uzgavenes. Une énorme effigie représentant l'hiver est brûlée et une bataille symbolique entre Lašininis, l'esprit de l'hiver, et Kanapinis, l'esprit personnifiant le printemps, est mise en scène. Pour le plus grand bonheur de tous, Kanapinis en sort victorieux, comme toujours.
column4: Eure Vasallen sind angekommen und die Zeit des Uzgavenes Festes ist nahe. Ein großes Bildnis, das den Winter darstellt, wird verbrannt und ein symbolischer Kampf zwischen Lašininis, dem Wintergeist, und Kanapinis, dem Geist des Frühlings, findet statt. Zur Freude aller siegt - wie immer - Kanapinis.
column6: Tus vasallos han llegado y es el momento del festival Uzgavenes. Se quema una gran efigie que representa el invierno, y se celebra una lucha simbólica entre Lašininis, el espíritu del invierno, y Kanapinis, el espíritu que personifica la primavera. Para el deleite de todos, Kanapinis sale victorioso, como siempre.

column2: As offerings and sacrifices continue to be placed on the altar outside, surely pleasing [Root.Religion.GetHighGodNameCap], you and your vassals gather for the great feast your servants have prepared!
column3: Alors que l'effigie de l'hiver se consume à l'extérieur, pressant l'arrivée de l'été, vos vassaux et vous êtes réunis pour savourer le grand banquet préparé par vos serviteurs.
column4: Während das Winterabbild draußen verbrennt und dadurch das Kommen des Sommers beschleunigt, versammeln sich Eure Vasallen und Ihr zum großen Festmahl, das Eure Diener vorbereitet haben.
column6: ¡Mientras la efigie del invierno continúa ardiendo fuera, acelerando la llegada del verano, tú y tus vasallos os reunís para la gran fiesta que han preparado tus sirvientes!

column2: As offerings and sacrifices continue to be placed on the altar outside, surely pleasing [Root.Religion.GetHighGodNameCap], you gather together with your liege and the rest of [From.GetHerHis] vassals for the great feast [From.GetSheHe] has had prepared!
column3: Alors que l'effigie de l'hiver se consume à l'extérieur, pressant l'arrivée de l'été, votre seigneur, le reste de ses vassaux et vous êtes réunis pour savourer le grand banquet préparé par ses serviteurs.
column4: Während das Winterabbild draußen verbrennt und dadurch das Kommen des Sommers beschleunigt, versammelt Ihr Euch mit Eurem Lehnsherr und anderen [From.GetHerHis] Vasallen zum großen Festmahl, das [From.GetSheHe] vorbereitet hat!
column6: ¡Mientras la efigie del invierno continúa ardiendo fuera, acelerando la llegada del verano, tú te reúnes con tu señor y el resto de [From.GetHerHis] vasallos para la gran fiesta que [From.GetSheHe] ha preparado!

column2: The offerings and sacrifices have been given, [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName] has been defeated, and the feast has come to an end. Your vassals are returning home, but most seem to agree that the festival to honor [Root.Religion.GetHighGodNameCap] was well worth the trip.
column3: L'effigie a fini de se consumer, l'esprit de Lašininis a été défait et le banquet tire à sa fin. Vos vassaux reprennent le chemin du retour et la plupart s'accordent pour dire que le festival de l'Uzgavenes en valait le déplacement
column4: Das Bildnis ist niedergebrannt, der Geist von Lašininis wurde besiegt und das Fest ist zu Ende. Eure Vasallen kehren nach Hause zurück, doch die meisten sind der Ansicht, dass das Uzgavenes Fest die Reise wert war.
column6: Se ha quemado la efigie, el espíritu de Lašininis ha sido derrotado, y la fiesta ha llegado a su fin. Tus vasallos están regresando a casa, pero la mayoría parecen estar de acuerdo con que el festival Uzgavenes valió la pena.

column2: The offerings and sacrifices have been given, [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName] has been defeated, and the feast has come to an end. You and the other vassals are returning home, but you all agree that the festival to honor [Root.Religion.GetHighGodNameCap] was well worth the trip.
column3: L'effigie a fini de se consumer, l'esprit de Lašininis a été défait et le banquet tire à sa fin. Les autres vassaux et vous reprenez le chemin du retour et vous vous accordez tous pour dire que le festival de l'Uzgavenes en valait le déplacement
column4: Das Bildnis ist niedergebrannt, der Geist von Lašininis wurde besiegt und das Fest ist zu Ende. Du und die anderen Vasallen kehren nach Hause zurück, doch alle sind der Ansicht, dass das Uzgavenes Fest die Reise wert war.
column6: Se ha quemado la efigie, el espíritu de Lašininis ha sido derrotado, y la fiesta ha llegado a su fin. Tú y los otros vasallos estÃ¡is regresando a casa, pero todos estÃ¡is de acuerdo con que el festival Uzgavenes valiÃ³ la pena.

column2: Held Religious Festival
Refused to attend Religious Festival
column3: Refus de participer au festival de l'Uzgavenes
column4: hat sich geweigert, Uzgavenes zu besuchen
column6: Se negÃ³ a asistir a Uzgavenes

column2: Held Religious Festival
Refused to attend Tawusgeran
Held Tawusgeran
All praise [Root.Religion.GetHighGodNameCap]!
column3: Le printemps viendra cette année, semble-t-il.
column4: Wie es aussieht, wird es dieses Jahr einen Frühling geben.
column6: Parece que la primavera vendrá este año.

column2: Chosen by [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodNameCap]

In the ancient prophecies of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith, it is written that a hero, the champion of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName], will be chosen from amongst his servants to start the end of times. This Chosen One will end the conflicts that plague the world and bring about the new [Root.Religion.GetName] order. Recently, a figure of such characteristics has risen in [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName], [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName], the chosen one of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodNameCap]!
I will bring the in a new world in the name of [From.Religion.GetRandomGodNameCap]
All hail [From.GetTitledFirstName], chosen of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodNameCap]!
The only thing [From.GetSheHe] will bring is chaos and death
Chosen One
This character is purported to be the chosen one of his or her messianic faith.
Armors were hacked while wind blew and howled: piles of corpses, piles of bodies, and a river of blood flowed! It is there!! It is time to charge!!
Not now! Fall back!
The stronger they are, the harder they fall!

The love of arms and the mad wickedness of war are raging: the battle inflame itself with multiple charges from every flank, orders are shouted and swords clash into armors and skulls alike. My men look at me with the bloody eyes of soldiers, asking me for an order that could sort the battle in our favor.
He who flies at the right time can fight again..
Charge!!

And many strokes, though with a little axe, hew down and fell the hardest-timbered oak: The battle is not lost yet, we still have a chance to win it with a blunt maneuver that could turn its destiny on our side!
A victory is twice itself when the achiever brings home full numbers.
Audaces fortuna iuvat!

As they charged through an open field towards the enemy lines, the enemy archers began to fire and plow and gather into the garner of death, as brave, and good, and pure spirits as the world ever saw. The twilight of evening had begun to gather as a precursor of the midnight darkness that was to envelop an epic clash..
Fall back!
Glory! Which gilds our sepulchre and embalms our name!

The general lifts the horn up to his mouth, then sets his lips and blows it with great force. The hills are high, the horn's voice loud and long. They hear it echoing full thirty leagues. The enemy and his companions hear it sound: Our men are in a battle!
I better stay behind the lines..
To me my men!

Watching from the woods the Wallace and the Moray, as the English came with the Earl o' Surrey, ain by ain they crossed, oh the bridge was rumbling. As they onward came, O'er the Brig o' Stirling. The Wallace gave a shout, out his men came running, stubbed the English host, at the Brig o' Stirling, Cressingham turned round, the bridge was small and turning, Moray cut him down, On the Brig o' Stirling.
This battle is lost!
The valiant never taste of death but once!

As I cam on, an farther on, an doun an by Harlaw, they fell fu close on ilka side, sic fun ye never saw. They fell fu close on ilka side, sic fun ye never saw. For Hielan swords gied clash for clash, at the battle o' Harlaw. The Hielanmen, wi their lang swords, they laid on us fu sair, an they drave back our merry men, three acres breadth an mair.
Oh no, oh no, my brither dear, that thing maun never be!
Tak ye your good sword in your hand, An come your wa's wi me!

After the enemy charge the clang of the bows and the shouts of the combatants mixed fearfully with the sound of the trumpets, and drowned the groans of the many good men who fell, and lay rolling defenseless beneath the feet of the horses. The splendid armour our knights is now defaced with dust and blood, and gives way at every stroke of the sword and battle-axe..
We are broken!
Charge, men, charge!
Any coward can fight a battle when he's sure of winning, but give me the man who has pluck to fight when he's sure of losing. That's my way, sir. And there are many victories worse than a defeat.
Retreat!
To Victory!

Hark! I hear the tramp of thousands, and of armed men the hum Lo! A nation's hosts have gathered Round the quick alarming drum saying: Come, Freemen, Come! Ere your heritage be wasted, said the quick alarming drum. The enemy charges!
Men, fall back!
They shall not pass!

In peace, there's nothing so becomes a man as modest stillness and humility, but when the blast of war blows in our ears, then imitate the action of the tiger: stiffen the sinews, summon up the blood, disguise fair nature with hard-favor'd rage.
Stand Still!
Up Guards and at 'em!
Victory is not ours yet. Charge at the enemy with full strength, may it lead us to glory, or to a glorious death. Shame for the ones who break, honor to the brave!
Retreat! Order the men to fall back, as it's not time to win or lose this battle just yet. Although many commanders will see this choice as craven, I know better..
The enemy charges, but victory isn't lost yet. Hold on and counter-attack with what strength we have left: may it lead us to glory in victory, or to a glorious death in battle!
And so I die.
